title: Dog The Bounty Hunter pays tribute to late wife Beth on what would have been her 52nd birthday
text:
Duane Chapman paid tribute to his late wife Beth on Tuesday on social media on what would have been her 52nd birthday.

The 66-year-old reality star, better known as Dog The Bounty Hunter, reposted an Instagram video featuring Beth and a photo of them together to remember her.

He first reposted a WGN America video with clips from their show Dog's Most Wanted that showed Beth and Dog working together as bounty hunters.

Birthday post: Duane Chapman took to Instagram and remembered his late wife Beth on what would have been her 52nd birthday

'This one's for Beth,' Dog said at the start of the clip.

Beth was seen on a radio helping Dog apprehend people and pointing out that someone was hiding in the trunk of a vehicle.

'If I'm gonna die, I'm gonna die in my boots,' said Beth, who died in June of complications from cancer.

Dog was also heard telling his wife, 'Listen, I love my job, but I love you more'.

Fan favorites: Beth and Dog, shown in November 2017 in Hawaii, got married in May 2006

For her: A video clip from Dog's Most Wanted showed the bounty hunter dedicating a job to Beth

Cancer diagnosis: Beth was shown in the clip saying she was going to die in her boots

High five: Dog in the clip was heard telling Beth that he loves his job but loves her even more

The original caption read: 'There will never be another like you. Happy birthday Beth! We [heart emoji] you!'.

Dog also reposted a photo that his ex-wife shared of them in February on Instagram.

They embraced each other in the snap while looking cheek-to-cheek at the camera.

Tender moment: The bounty hunter also reposted a photo of him and Beth that she shared in February on Instagram

'Sooooo in love with this guy!,' Beth wrote in the caption.

Beth was diagnosed with stage 2 throat cancer in September 2017.

She was in remission, but cancer later spread to her lungs and she received a stage four diagnosis.

Throat cancer: Beth, shown with Dog in September 2008 in Hollywood, was diagnosed with throat cancer in September 2017

Beth and Dog started filming Dog's Most Wanted in early 2019 and she was hospitalized during production on June 22 and placed in a medically induced coma.

The Denver native died on June 26 of complications from cancer and some of her ashes were scattered at sea.

Dog has a daughter Bonnie, 20, and son Garry, 18, with Beth and also adopted her 26-year-old daughter Cecily from her ex-husband.
description: The 66-year-old reality star paid tribute to his late wife Beth on Tuesday on social media on what would have been her 52nd birthday.
